info.title: Ingest
info.description: Load data into entities, relationships, interactions, crosswalks and reference data.

post.summary: Creates a new mapping based on the details provided in the request
post.description: Creates a new mapping for an object type. For creating the mapping, you must provide details for 'object type', 'summary', 'name', and 'object type URI'

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

403.description: The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges

404.description: The resource requested was not found

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

get.summary: Retrieves the existing mapping details using an ID
get.description: Retrieves the existing mapping details using an ID

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: mappingId
parameters.description: Defines the ID of the mapping for which details are to be retrieved

parameters.name: includeProjects
parameters.description: If true, API response includes the job definition IDs associated with the mapping

200.description: The details for mapping are retrieved successfully

403.description: Check your privileges to do this operation

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

put.summary: Updates existing mapping based on the details provided in the request
put.description: Updates an existing mapping. You can add new values for a field or modify the existing values. Before saving the updates, the mapping details are validated based on the business rules

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: mappingId
parameters.description: ID of the mapping for which the details are to be updated

403.description: Check your privileges to do this operation

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

delete.description: Deletes an existing mapping if all the business rules are met. The mapping cannot be deleted if it is being used by any job definition

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: mappingId
parameters.description: ID of the mapping that must be deleted

403.description: The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

get.description: Retrieve the details of all mappings for a tenant matching the filter criteria

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: entityType
parameters.description: Object type URL for which mappings must be retrieved

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description:
Specify the user name that must be included in the 'equals' and 'not equals' operations while retrieving the mapping details.
For example:
  • 'createdBy=username@reltio.com' - returns the list of mappings created by the specified user for the tenant
  • 'createdBy=username@reltio.com:notequals' - returns the list of mappings which are not created by the specified user for the tenant

parameters.name: creationDate
parameters.description: Long value of date. API returns all the mappings created on or after the specified date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Define the page number in which the API response with pagination are obtained.
For example: page=1

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects that need to be returned with a paged response

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Defines how the API response is sorted. API supports sorting based on any text fields in the model.
For example: 'sort=tenantId' - sorts the mappings in the ascending order of Tenant ID, 'sort=tenantId:desc' - sorts the mapping in the descending order of Tenant ID.
More than one text fields in the model can be used to define the sorting order. For example: 'sort=tenantId:desc,objectTypeUri' - sorts the API response in the descending order of Tenant ID and 'objectTypeUris' are used for second order sorting

parameters.name: includeProjects
parameters.description: If 'true', API response includes the job definitions IDs

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Used to define the criteria to get resources. One or more text fields in the response can be used to define the filter criteria. Filtering can be done by 'equals', 'notEquals' and 'like' operation while getting the resources.
For example: filter=equals(),notequals()

200.description: Mapping details matching criteria are retrieved successfully

403.description: The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.description: Name of the limit which can be filtered upon to retrieve the details

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Define the page number in which the API response with pagination are obtained.
For example: page=1

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects that need to be returned with a paged response

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Defines how the API response is sorted. API supports sorting based on any text fields in the model.
For example: 'sort=tenantId' - sorts the source details in the ascending order of tenantId, 'sort=tenantId:desc' - sorts the source details in the descending order of Tenant ID.
More than one text fields in the model can be used to define the sorting order. For example: 'sort=tenantId:desc,environment:desc' - sorts the API response in the descending order of tenantId and 'environment'

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Used to define the criteria to get resources. One or more text fields in the response can be used to define the filter criteria. Filtering can be done by 'equals', 'notEquals' and 'like' operation while getting the resources.
For example: filter=equals(),notequals()

get.summary: Returns all the existing jobs for a tenant
get.description: Retrieve the details of existing jobs for a tenant matching the filter criteria

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: ID of the existing job definitions to get job details

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Job status used to filter the jobs

parameters.name: inProgress
parameters.description: Used to retrieve either inprogress or completed jobs

parameters.name: creationDate
parameters.description: Criteria to filter and get jobs which are created on or after long value of date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Define the page number in which the API response with pagination are obtained.
For example: page=1

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of objects that need to be returned with a paged response

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Defines how the API response is sorted. API supports sorting based on any text fields in the model.
For example: 'sort=name' - sorts the job definitions in the ascending order of name, 'sort=name:desc' - sorts the job definitions in the descending order of name
More than one text fields in the model can be used to define the sorting order. For example: 'sort=tenantId:desc,name:desc' - sorts the API response in the descending order of tenantId and 'name'

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Used to define the criteria to get resources. One or more text fields in the response can be used to define the filter criteria. Filtering can be done by 'equals', 'notEquals' and 'like' operation while getting the resources.
For example: filter=equals(),notequals()

post.description:
This API saves a collection of lookups in RDM tenant according to the JSON object definition. If you need to create just one lookup value then please specify one JSON object in the array. The same API should be used for create and update operations.

You can create a maximum of 100 lookup codes in a single request.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the RDM tenant

requestBody.description: A collection of lookups to be saved in a tenant

values.description: USA definition in the Reltio source system.

localizations.description: United States of America in Italian translation.

401.description: The operation cannot be performed because user is unauthorized

403.description: The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

post.summary: Save lookup values that are not mapped to a canonical value.
post.description:
This API saves a collection of unmapped lookups in RDM tenant according to the JSON object definition. If you need to create just one unmapped lookup value then please specify one JSON object in the array. The same API should be used for create and update operations.

You should use this API when you have lookups from a source but still don't have the corresponding canonical value in the lookup type. Once the canonical value is defined for those unmapped lookups from a source, please use Save Lookup API with the details from unmapped mapping and then delete the unmapped value.

You can create a maximum of 100 unmapped values in a single request.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the RDM tenant

parameters.name: onlyIfNoMapping
parameters.description: If set to true, then unmapped values are created for values that do not have a mapping on the tenant. If set to false, then unmapped values are created for all values that are sent in the request.

requestBody.description: A collection of unmapped lookups to be saved in a tenant

401.description: The operation cannot be performed because user is unauthorized

403.description: The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

post.summary: Save lookup values that are not mapped to a canonical value for the specified lookup type.
post.description:
This API saves a collection of unmapped lookups in RDM tenant according to the JSON object definition. If you need to create just one unmapped lookup value then please specify one JSON object in the array. The same API should be used for create and update operations.

You should use this API when you have lookups from a source but still don't have the corresponding canonical value in the lookup type. Once the canonical value is defined for those unmapped lookups from a source, please use Save Lookup API with the details from unmapped mapping and then delete the unmapped value.

You can create a maximum of 100 unmapped values in a single request.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the RDM tenant

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Lookup type for which unmapped values must be created

parameters.name: onlyIfNoMapping
parameters.description: If set to true, then unmapped values are created for values that do not have a mapping on the tenant. If set to false, then unmapped values are created for all values that are sent in the request.

requestBody.description: A collection of unmapped lookups to be saved in a tenant for the specified lookup type

401.description: The operation cannot be performed because user is unauthorized

403.description: The operation is forbidden for the current user, please check your privileges

500.description: Internal server error, see details in the returned error message

post.description:
This API saves a collection of entities in Reltio Platform according to JSON object definition. To create just one entity using this API, specify one JSON object in the array.
If you post an entity with some crosswalks (for example, crosswalk1 and crosswalk2), and that entity corresponds to some existing entities (entity1 and entity2) in the Reltio Platform, then these entities are merged in one entity referred as the survivor (for example, entity1 would be merged in entity2). After this, the resultant survivor entity (for example, entity2) is updated with the new information from a posted entity. If no entities are found or provided in the posted entity crosswalk or no crosswalks are provided, then a new entity is created.
Note: If you do not specify roles in the request, then all roles from the entity being overwritten remain unchanged. To remove all roles from the resultant entity specify an empty array of roles in the POST /entities request.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: returnObjects
parameters.description: Specifies if the response should contain created entities. Default is true.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • nonOvOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="false" will be present in the resulting JSON. This option is mutually exclusive with the ovOnly option. Has a lower priority than ovOnly
  • ovOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="true" will be present in the resulting JSON
  • partialOverride - This option may be used for POST /entities or POST /relations (override entity or relation) request. If this option is presented, platform overrides attributes that are specified in the request. We do not touch any other attributes of the dataprovider crosswalk
  • partialOverrideForReference - This option may be used for POST /entities (override entity) request. If this option is presented, platform override all attributes, but for references we do not touch any attributes not involved to referencedAttributeURIs
  • preserveHidden - This option may be used for the POST /entities request. If it is true then API will not delete hidden attributes if they are not specified in the request
  • preserveURIs - This option may be used for the POST /entities request. If it is true then API takes into account uris that are specified for attribute values inside the request
  • updateAttributeUpdateDates - This option may be used for POST /entities and POST /relations requests. 'singleAttributeUpdateDates' property of crosswalks will be updated for changed and new attributes if this option is presented.

post.description: This API is an aggregate of Search and Save API.It retrieves the individual entities or searches for multiple entities and based on the search result, this API saves a collection of entities in Reltio Platform according to JSON object definition.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Enables entities filtering by a condition. Format for filter query parameter: filter=({Condition Type}[AND/OR {Condition Type}]*).
For more information, please visit https://docs.reltio.com

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of properties from object structure that should be returned in a response. Allows you to return a partial object. List of object properties you can find at the response model. Additional system properties are:
  • attributes._lookupCodes: return codes for lookup attributes.
  • attributes._lookupValues: return values for lookup attributes.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify maximum number of entities to return in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the "offset" parameter.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Positive Integer value to identify starting what element in a result set should be returned in a response. Can be used to organize pagination in combination with the max parameter.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Entity objects property that should be used for sorting. Can be used in combination with the "order" parameter to have reverse order. If this parameter is not provided or if the value cannot be recognized, then no sorting is used.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
Order of sorting. Applicable only in combination with the sort parameter. Possible values:
  • asc - results are shown in ascending order.
  • desc - results are shown in descending order.

parameters.name: defaultMaxValues
parameters.description: Specifies maximum number of values listed in attributes. This restriction is intended for more efficient responses in the case of very long lists of values in some attributes.

parameters.name: scoreEnabled
parameters.description: When set to true, documents with search hits in labels get more search relevance score.

parameters.name: activeness
parameters.description:
Defines whether to include active and expired entities into the results. By default, only active entities are included in the response. Possible values:
  • all - include both active and expired entities
  • active - include only active entities
  • not_active - include only expired entities

parameters.name: returnObjects
parameters.description: Specifies if the response should contain created entities. Default is true.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • nonOvOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="false" will be present in the resulting JSON. This option is mutually exclusive with the ovOnly option. Has a lower priority than ovOnly
  • ovOnly - If it is specified, then only attributes with ov="true" will be present in the resulting JSON
  • partialOverride - This option may be used for POST /entities or POST /relations (override entity or relation) request. If this option is presented, platform overrides attributes that are specified in the request. We do not touch any other attributes of the dataprovider crosswalk
  • partialOverrideForReference - This option may be used for POST /entities (override entity) request. If this option is presented, platform override all attributes, but for references we do not touch any attributes not involved to referencedAttributeURIs
  • preserveHidden - This option may be used for the POST /entities request. If it is true then API will not delete hidden attributes if they are not specified in the request
  • preserveURIs - This option may be used for the POST /entities request. If it is true then API takes into account uris that are specified for attribute values inside the request
  • updateAttributeUpdateDates - This option may be used for POST /entities and POST /relations requests. 'singleAttributeUpdateDates' property of crosswalks will be updated for changed and new attributes if this option is presented.

parameters.name: applyIfNoMatches
parameters.description: Specifies if the system should apply the request body depending on search results. Default is true.

parameters.name: returnMatches
parameters.description: Specifies if the system should return the search results in the response. Default is true.

post.summary: Creates a collection of interactions in a tenant
post.description: This API creates a collection of interactions in the Reltio Platform according to the JSON object definition. To create just one interaction using this API, specify one JSON object in the array.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: Source-System
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the source system that this request is representing. For example, "configuration/sources/Reltio" indicates that the data is not loaded from other source systems and is instead created in the Reltio Platform directly.

parameters.name: crosswalkValue
parameters.description: This parameter indicates the identifier of an interaction object in the source system

parameters.name: returnObjects
parameters.description: This parameter specifies if the response must contain the created objects

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • sendHidden - Specifies whether the hidden attributes will appear in the response

post.description:
This API saves a collection of relations in the Reltio Platform according to the JSON object definition or to create just one relation using this API, specify one JSON object in the array. You can use the referenced entityURI or referenced entity crosswalk to describe the startObject and/or the endObject.
When a new relation is created with URIs for start and end objects, inconsistencies may appear if the relation is created with empty crosswalks inside the startObject and endObject sections. If the connectRelationsToDefaultCrosswalk property available in the physical configuration is enabled and then you create a relation, the startObject and endObject sections are filled with the default crosswalks automatically.

Note: A crosswalk with the source, which is equal to the value of the default crosswalk in the physical configuration (default value is Reltio), and value= is considered as the default crosswalk.

If the connectRelationsToDefaultCrosswalk property is set to true when a relation is created with empty crosswalks for the start and end objects of the relation, the following rules are applied:
  • If the start entity has a Reltio crosswalk with the same value as its ID, this crosswalk is used as the crosswalk for the start object in the relation. Else, a new Reltio crosswalk with the value equal to the entity ID is created. This new crosswalk is added to the winner contributor of the start entity and the start object of the relation is connected to this new Reltio crosswalk.
  • The behavior is the same for the end entity. If the end entity has a Reltio crosswalk with the same value as its ID, this crosswalk is used as the crosswalk for the end object in the relation. Else, a new Reltio crosswalk with the value equal to the entity ID is created. This new crosswalk is added to the winner contributor of the end entity and the end object of the relation is connected to this new Reltio crosswalk.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant

parameters.name: returnObjects
parameters.description: Specifies if the response should contain created relations. Default is true.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of different options which affect endpoints behaviour. Available options:
  • ignoreOverrideIgnorePinSetting - This option may be used for POST /entities and POST /relations requests. If it is specified then 'overrideIgnorePin' setting in business model will be ignored for the 'override' action
  • partialOverride - This option may be used for POST /entities or POST /relations (override entity or relation) request. If this option is presented, platform overrides attributes that are specified in the request. We do not touch any other attributes of the dataprovider crosswalk
  • rejectRelationsToInactiveObjects - This option may be used to validate entities used for creating relations should be active. If the value is present it will not allow the creation of relation if any/both entity is/are inactive
  • updateAttributeUpdateDates - This option may be used for POST /entities and POST /relations requests. 'singleAttributeUpdateDates' property of crosswalks will be updated for changed and new attributes if this option is presented.

mappingId.description: System generated read only mapping id

tenantId.description: Tenant Id for which the mapping is created

shareMappingDetails.description: Allow use of mapping with multiple job definitions

projectIds.description: IDs of Job definition using mapping

id.description: System generated read only limits id

tenantId.description: Tenant ID for which limit is created

environment.description: Environment to which tenant belongs to

id.description: System generated read only scheduled job id

shareSourceInfo.description: Allow use of storage details with multiple job definitions

fileMask.description: common file prefix to filter and pick one or more files from provided source path

credentials.description:
Base64 encoded json with keys and secret to connect to remote storages.
Json having below mentioned details should be Base64 encoded and provided as value.
  • For Storage type GCP, Service account json with access to bucket should be encoded and set as value
  • For Storage type S3, json having attributes accessKey, secretKey, region or role, externalId, region should be encoded and set as value
  • For Storage type SFTP json having attributes host, userName, password should be encoded and set as value
  • For Storage type Azure, json having cloudAccountName, cloudAccountKey should be encoded and set as value

environment.description: Environment for which job definition is getting created

updateType.description: Update type, full or partial update

errorFileLocation.description: Location of error files in GCS

additionalAttributes.description: json representing additional configuration of job definition

errorFileLocation.description: Location of error files in GCS

jobSummary.description: Additional information about various job statistics

ludicrousMode.description: Enables job to run in ludicrous mode

errorMessage.example: Incorrect tenant id provided for value: user_tenant_id/State/Reltio/AR

API Error.description: Contains detailed information about occurred error

tenantId.description: ID of the RDM tenant. It has to match the following Regex pattern: [a-zA-Z_0-9]{2,32}.

type.description: Lookup Type URI. It has to starts with 'rdm/lookupTypes/'.

code.description: Canonical code. If a generator is defined for the Lookup Type then code might be omitted otherwise it is required.

enabled.description: Status flag for the lookup code to enable it to use in transcoding operations. Default value is true.

startDate.description: Timestamp of the date when the lookup code will be enabled.

endDate.description: Timestamp of the date when the lookup code will be disabled.

parents.description: List of parents for the lookup code.

sourceMappings.description: Mapping definitions between a source system and values which can come from this source system.

localizations.description: Lookup value definitions for different languages.

attributes.description: Attribute values of the lookup code.

updatedBy.description: Identifier of the user who made last update

Lookup Code.description: Definition of a lookup code along with its hierarchy, localizations, source mappings and attributes.

Lookup Attribute Value.description: Definition of a value of the lookup type attribute.

value.description: Localized value of a lookup code for the specified language code.

description.example: United States of America in Italian translation.

Lookup Localization.description: Definition of a localization for a lookup code.

exception.example:
"com.reltio.rdm.utils.RDMUtils.precondition at RDMUtils.java, line 153",
                    "com.reltio.rdm.model.base.Model.setRdTenantId at Model.java, line 91",...

stack.example: com.reltio.rdm.RDMException:Incorrect tenant id provided for value: user_tenant_id/State/Reltio/AR

code.description: Source code which comes from a source system.

value.description: Source value to represent the source code.

description.example: USA definition in the Reltio source system.

enabled.description: Status flag for the source value to enable it to use in transcoding operations. Default value is true.

canonicalValue.description:
Flag for the source value to make its value property as a canonical value for the lookup code.
Only one source value can be defined as canonical value.

downStreamDefaultValue.description:
Flag for the source value to make it as default value of LoV bounded fields. If set to true, the code and value become the default values for that source. Only one value can be set to true per source.
This is applicable only for reverse transcoding when there are several values/codes for the same source. For more information on reverse transcoding, see Reltio Documentation.

Source Value.description: Definition of a value from a source system.

values.description: Values which can come from the source system

Source Mapping.description: Definition of a mapping between a source system and values which can come from this source system.

warningMessage.example: Tenant has already got a mapping for this type, source and value.

API Warning.description: Contains detailed information about occurred warning

tenantId.description: ID of the RDM tenant. It has to match the following Regex pattern: [a-zA-Z_0-9]{2,32}.

type.description: Lookup type that has an unmapped value

code.description: Lookup code for an unmapped lookup

value.description: Lookup value for an unmapped lookup

attributes.description: Custom attributes for an unmapped lookup

updatedBy.description: Identifier of the user who made last update

Unmapped lookup.description: Definition of a lookup that is not mapped to a canonical value.

analyticsAttributes.description: Analytics attributes the entity possesses. Analytics attributes can include simple and nested attributes. Each analytics attribute has a reference to its configuration type. Analytics attributes are grouped by attribute configuration. AnalyticsAttributeValueTO values must of the SimpleAnalyticsAttributeValueTO, NestedAnalyticsAttributeValueTO types.

secondaryLabel.description: An entity label that is built using the entity type configuration secondaryLabelPattern and data from an entity. Since label information is generally used in the results of a search, more information can be included in the entity label to give it more unique characteristics when displayed near similar results.

label.description: An entity label that is built using the entity type configuration dataLabelPattern and data of an entity.

roles.description: An array of entity roles associated with the entity.

CrosswalkExternalInfo.description: Additional information of crosswalk. This information is filled by Reltio services like DTSS.

createdBy.description: Identifier of user created this object. This field is filled in automatically.

updatedBy.description: Identifier of user updated this object. This field is filled in automatically.

createdTime.description: Time of creation of this object (Timestamp). This field is filled in automatically.

updatedTime.description: Time of update of this object (Timestamp). This field is filled in automatically.

ObjectTO.description: Base object model of EntityTO, RelationTO

index.description: Index of an attribute value in JSON Array from response

tenantId.description: Tenant Id of Data Tenant provided by DTSS

matchReasons.description: Set of reasons why DTSS has updated this object

DTSSInfo.description: Additional information of crosswalk provided by DTSS

value.description: ID of a record in a source system

sourceTable.description: Name of a table for a record in a source system

singleAttributeUpdateDates.description: This field of crosswalk contains update date for specific attributes.

attributes.description: Set of attributes of this crosswalk

dataProvider.description: This field determines if this crosswalk is data provider. Default is true

AnalyticsAttributeValueTO.description: Base model of SimpleAnalyticsAttributeValueTO, NestedAnalyticsAttributeValueTO attribute objects.

index.description: Index of an attribute value in JSON Array from response

members.description: Map of interaction members by member type

timestamp.description:
Timestamp when the interaction occurred.
Accepts:
  • YYYY-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ
  • MM/dd/YYYY
  • MM.dd.YYYY
  • MM-dd-YYYY
  • YYYY/MM/dd
  • YYYY-MM-dd
  • YYYY.MM.dd
  • YYYYMMdd
  • MM/dd/YYYY HH.mm
  • MM.dd.YYYY HH.mm
  • MM-dd-YYYY HH.mm
  • YYYY/MM/dd HH:mm:ss
  • Unix time in milliseconds
Returns:
  • Unix time in milliseconds
Note: the Reltio Platform accepts a value of the integer or string type, but always returns a value of the integer type (Unix time in milliseconds)

index.description: Index of an attribute value in JSON Array from response

startRefPinned.description: A flag indicates whether the reference attribute of the start entity defined by this relationship is pinned.

analyticsAttributes.description: Analytics attributes the relation possesses. Analytics attributes can include simple and nested attributes. Each analytics attribute has a reference to its configuration type. Analytics attributes are grouped by attribute configuration. AnalyticsAttributeValueTO values must of the SimpleAnalyticsAttributeValueTO, NestedAnalyticsAttributeValueTO types.

endRefPinned.description: A flag indicates whether the reference attribute of the end entity defined by this relationship is pinned.

endRefIgnored.description: A flag indicates whether the reference attribute of the end entity defined by this relationship is ignored.

startRefIgnored.description: A flag indicates whether the reference attribute of the start entity defined by this relationship is ignored.

allOf.description: Relationship object model, defines a connection between two entities

directionalLabel.description: A label for the relationship, from the start/end object's perspective

EntityTOConnection.description: Start/end entity object of a RelationTO

allOf.description: Nested Attribute is a object which can contain another interconnected attributes. NestedAttributeValueTO can contain NestedAttributeValueTO and SimpleAttributeValueTO.

startObjectCrosswalks.description: start objects crosswalks of reference attribute

allOf.description: This object is combination of attributes of EntityTO and RelationTO. ReferenceAttributeValueTO can contain SimpleAttributeValueTO, NestedAttributeValueTO.

AttributeValueTO.description: Super model for NestedAttributeValueTO, ReferenceAttributeValueTO, SimpleAttributeValueTO for Attribute item

startRefPinned.description: Ref Relation Uri is start Pinned?

endRefPinned.description: Ref Relation Uri is end Pinned?

startRefIgnored.description: Ref Relation Uri is start Ignored?

entityURI.description: URI of an entity type or role that can be a member of the type
